original: Dīgha Nikāya 4
analyzed: dīgha nikāya
translated: Long Discourses

original: Soṇadaṇḍasutta
analyzed: soṇadaṇḍasutta
translated: With Sonadanda

original: 1. Campeyyakabrāhmaṇagahapatikā
analyzed: campeyyaka brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The Brahmins and householders of Campā

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—🔽ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā aṅgesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi yena campā tadavasari.
analyzed: evam me suta  ekam samayam bhagavā aṅgesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi yena campā tat avasari
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā campāyaṁ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā campāyam viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre
translated: Once the Buddha was wandering in the Anga country with a large community of monks, with about 500 monks. He arrived at Campā and stayed by a lotus pond called “Gaggarā.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo campaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena soṇadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ campam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rāja bhoggam raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnam rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: At that time the brahmin Sonadanda was living at Campā. It was a town in the lowlands, a royal city, where King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha had a country residence. It was a prosperous city, with many inhabitants, full of people, with plenty of food and crowds at the crossroads.

original: Assosuṁ kho campeyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā:
analyzed: assosum kho campeyyakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The brahmins and householders of Campā heard:

original: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito aṅgesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā🔽bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi campaṁ anuppatto campāyaṁ viharati
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ aṅgesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā  bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi campam an uppattaḥ campāyam viharati
translated: “The ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—has arrived at Campā and is staying by the Gaggarā lotus pond.

original: gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre.
analyzed: gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre
translated: He has this good reputation:🔽‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, a Happy One, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Blessed One.’

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: And this good report about Master Gotama has spread:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’.🔽So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā  saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: ‘Such is he, the Blessed One, perfected one, fully enlightened one, accomplished in true knowledge and conduct, fortunate one, knower of the world, unsurpassed trainer of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened one, the Blessed One.’🔽He reveals this world with its devas, māras, and Brahmās, this generation with its contemplatives and brahmans, its royalty and common people; he reveals this generation with its devas, māras, and Brahmās, this generation with its contemplatives and brahmans, its royalty and common people, having realized it for himself with direct knowledge.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma admirable in its beginning, admirable in its middle, and admirable in its end, with the goal of the holy life itself, revealing and making it plain a spiritual life perfectly complete and pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It is good to see such arahants.’

original: Atha kho campeyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā campāya nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūtā yena gaggarā pokkharaṇī tenupasaṅkamanti.
analyzed: atha kho campeyyakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā campāya nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūtā yena gaggarā pokkharaṇī tena upasaṅkamanti
translated: Then the brahmin householders of Campā left Campā in a body, in a group, and went to the Gaggarā Lotus Pond.

original: Tena kho pana samayena soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo uparipāsāde divāseyyaṁ upagato hoti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena soṇadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ upari pāsāde divāseyyam upagataḥ hoti
translated: Just then, the brahmin Sonadanda had gone up to the terrace on top of his stilt house for his midday nap.

original: Addasā kho soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo campeyyake brāhmaṇagahapatike campāya nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūte yena gaggarā pokkharaṇī tenupasaṅkamante.
analyzed: addasā kho soṇadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ campeyyake brāhmaṇa gahapatike campāya nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūte yena gaggarā pokkharaṇī tena upasaṅkamante
translated: He saw the brahmin householders of Campā leaving Campā in a great crowd,

original: Disvā khattaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: disvā khattam āmantesi
translated: and he addressed his steward thus:

original: “kiṁ nu kho, bho khatte, campeyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā campāya nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūtā yena gaggarā pokkharaṇī tenupasaṅkamantī”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho bho khatte campeyyakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā campāya nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūtā yena gaggarā pokkharaṇī tena upasaṅkamanti iti
translated: “Steward, why are the brahmin householders of Campā leaving Campā in a great crowd?”

original: “Atthi kho, bho, samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito aṅgesu cārikaṁ caramāno
analyzed: atthi kho bho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ aṅgesu cārikam caramāno
translated: “Master, there is a recluse named Gotama, a son of the Sakyans, who went forth from a Sakyan clan.

original: mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi campaṁ anuppatto campāyaṁ
analyzed: mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi campam an uppattaḥ campāya
translated: He is wandering on a tour of Aṅga with a large Sangha of bhikkhus, with five hundred bhikkhus,

original: viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre.
analyzed: viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre
translated: and after reaching Campā he is staying by Gaggara’s lotus pond.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: Now a good report of Master Gotama has been spread to this effect:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: Tamete bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamantī”ti.
analyzed: tam ete bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamanti iti
translated: That is why they are going to see the Lord Gotama.”

original: “Tena hi, bho khatte, yena campeyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tenupasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā campeyyake brāhmaṇagahapatike evaṁ vadehi:
analyzed: tena hi bho khatte yena campeyyakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā campeyyake brāhmaṇa gahapatike evam vadehi
translated: “Well then, Khattiya, go to the brahmin householders of Campā and say to them:

original: ‘soṇadaṇḍo, bho, brāhmaṇo evamāha—
analyzed: soṇadaṇḍaḥ bho brāhmaṇaḥ evam āha
translated: ‘The brahmin Sonadanda says this:

original: āgamentu kira bhavanto, soṇadaṇḍopi brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: āgamentu kira bhavantaḥ soṇadaṇḍaḥ api brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: “Let the honourable gentlemen come, the brahmin Sonadanda will also go to see the recluse Gotama.”’”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho so khattā soṇadaṇḍassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena campeyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā campeyyake brāhmaṇagahapatike etadavoca:
analyzed: eva bhoti kho saḥ khattā soṇadaṇḍassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena campeyyakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā campeyyake brāhmaṇa gahapatike etat avoca
translated: “Yes, sir,” he replied, and he went to the brahmins and householders of Campā and told them.

original: “soṇadaṇḍo bho brāhmaṇo evamāha:
analyzed: soṇadaṇḍaḥ bho brāhmaṇaḥ evam āha
translated: “The brahmin Sonadanda says this:

original: ‘āgamentu kira bhavanto, soṇadaṇḍopi brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: āgamentu kira bhavantaḥ soṇadaṇḍaḥ api brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: ‘Please come, sirs, the brahmin Sonadanda will also go to see the ascetic Gotama.’

original: 2. Soṇadaṇḍaguṇakathā
translated: The account of the qualities of Sonadanda

original: Tena kho pana samayena nānāverajjakānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ pañcamattāni brāhmaṇasatāni campāyaṁ paṭivasanti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena nānā verajjakānam brāhmaṇānam pañcamattāni brāhmaṇa satāni campāyam paṭivasanti kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: At that time, five hundred brahmins from various states were staying at Campā on some business.

original: Assosuṁ kho te brāhmaṇā:
analyzed: assosum kho te brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: They heard that

original: “soṇadaṇḍo kira brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī”ti.
analyzed: soṇadaṇḍaḥ kira brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: “Sonadanda is going to see the ascetic Gotama.”

original: Atha kho te brāhmaṇā yena soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā soṇadaṇḍaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha khalu te brāhmaṇāḥ yena soṇadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tena upasaṅkamiṣu upasaṅkamitvā soṇadaṇḍam brāhmaṇam etat avocuḥ
translated: Then they went to Sonadanda and said to him:

original: “saccaṁ kira bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: “Is it true, Master Sonadanda, that you are going to see the ascetic Gotama?”

original: “Evaṁ kho me, bho, hoti:🔽‘ahampi samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmī’”ti.
analyzed: evam khalu me bho hoti  aham pi samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmi iti
translated: “That is true, sirs.”

original: “Mā bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkami.
analyzed: mā bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkami
translated: “But why, Master Sonadanda, do you want to see the ascetic Gotama?🔽He is a trickster, a creator of illusions, a deceiver of the people.

original: Na arahati bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: na arahati bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: Master Soṇadaṇḍa is not worthy to come and see the recluse Gotama.

original: Sace bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati, bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati.
analyzed: sace bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yasaḥ hāyissati samaṇassa gotamassa yasaḥ abhivaḍḍhissati
translated: If Master Soṇadaṇḍa were to come and see the recluse Gotama, his fame would diminish and that of the recluse Gotama would increase.

original: Yampi bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati, imināpaṅgena na arahati bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: yam pi bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa yasaḥ hāyissati samaṇassa gotamassa yasaḥ abhivaḍḍhissati iminā apaṅgena na arahati bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: Since Master Soṇadaṇḍa’s fame would diminish and that of the recluse Gotama would increase, for this reason also Master Soṇadaṇḍa is not worthy to come and see the recluse Gotama;

original: samaṇo tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ soṇadaṇḍaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.🔽Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ tu eva gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam soṇadaṇḍam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu  bhavan hi soṇadaṇḍaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: rather, the recluse Gotama is worthy to come and see Master Soṇadaṇḍa.🔽Master Soṇadaṇḍa is well born on both sides, of pure maternal and paternal descent seven generations back, unassailable and impeccable in respect of birth.

original: Yampi bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva
analyzed: bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ
translated: Since Master Soṇadaṇḍa is well born on both sides…

original: sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena, imināpaṅgena na arahati bhavaṁ🔽soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena iminā apaṅgena na arahati bhava  soṇadaṇḍaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: for seven generations of ancestors he has not been reproached or criticized for his family lineage. For this reason, too,🔽it is not proper for Master Soṇadaṇḍa to go to see the recluse Gotama;

original: samaṇo tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ soṇadaṇḍaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ tu eva gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam soṇadaṇḍam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: rather, it is proper for the recluse Gotama to come to see Master Soṇadaṇḍa.

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo …pe…🔽Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo ajjhāyako mantadharo tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ🔽sākkharappabhedānaṁ itihāsapañcamānaṁ padako veyyākaraṇo, lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇa daṇḍaḥ aḍḍhaḥ mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogo  bhavan hi soṇadaṇḍaḥ ajjhāyakaḥ manta dharo tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhāna  itihāsa pañcamānam padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu anavayaḥ pe
translated: Master Soṇadaṇḍa is rich, with great wealth and great possessions …🔽Master Soṇadaṇḍa is a master of the Three Vedas, with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology, and the histories as a fifth; skilled in philology and grammar, he is fully versed in natural philosophy and in the marks of a Great Man. …

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato brahmavaṇṇī brahmavacchasī akhuddāvakāso dassanāya …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇadaṇḍaḥ abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇa pokkharatāya samannāgataḥ brahma vaṇṇī brahma vacchasī a khudda avakāsaḥ dassanāya pe
translated: Master Soṇadaṇḍa is handsome, comely, graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion, with sublime beauty and sublime presence, extraordinary and stunning, who delights the eyes of those who see him. …

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo sīlavā vuddhasīlī vuddhasīlena samannāgato …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇadaṇḍaḥ sīlavā vuddha sīlī vuddha sīlena samannāgato pe
translated: Master Soṇadaṇḍa is virtuous, of good character, one who has long been virtuous and of good character. …

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo kalyāṇavāco kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇadaṇḍo kalyāṇa vācaḥ kalyāṇa vāc karaṇo poriyāḥ vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā pe
translated: You are a good speaker, a speaker of what is well-spoken, endowed with speech that is polished, clear, articulate, expressing well the meaning. …

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo bahūnaṁ ācariyapācariyo tīṇi māṇavakasatāni mante vāceti. Bahū🔽kho pana nānādisā nānājanapadā māṇavakā āgacchanti bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa santike mantatthikā
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇa daṇḍaḥ bahūnam tīṇi māṇavaka satāni mante vācā iti bahū  kho pana nānādisāḥ nānā janapadāḥ māṇavakāḥ āgacchanti bhoto soṇadaṇḍassa santike mantatthikā
translated: You are the teacher of many, the preceptor of many, you teach three hundred youths to recite the hymns.

original: mante adhiyitukāmā …pe…
analyzed: mante adhiyitu kāmā pe
translated: Many youths have come to you from various states and countries, wishing to study the hymns. …

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto;
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇadaṇḍaḥ jiṇṇaḥ vuddhaḥ mahallakaḥ addha gataḥ vayaḥ anuppatto
translated: You are old, aged, burdened with years, advanced in life, and come to the last stage;

original: samaṇo gotamo taruṇo ceva taruṇapabbajito ca …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamo taruṇaḥ ca iva taruṇa pabbajito ca pe
translated: the ascetic Gotama is young, a youth, a black-haired young man …

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇadaṇḍaḥ raññaḥ māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: You are honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and given precedence over by King Bimbisāra of Magadha …

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇa daṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: You are honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and given precedence over by the brahmin Pokkharasāti …

original: Bhavañhi soṇadaṇḍo campaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ, raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnaṁ, rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: bhavan hi soṇadaṇḍaḥ campam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rājabhogga raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinna rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: “Master Soṇadaṇḍa dwells in Campā, a populous place, full of grass and timber, rich in grain and corn, crowded with people, teeming with human beings—a place that provides intercourse with the outside world, granted by King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha as a royal gift and grant to Soṇadaṇḍa, with authority to exercise kingship as a king.

original: Yampi bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo campaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ, raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnaṁ, rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: yam pi bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ campam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rājabhogga raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinna rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: “Master Soṇadaṇḍa dwells in Campā…

original: Imināpaṅgena na arahati bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: iminā apaṅgena na arahati bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: On account of this too Master Soṇadaṇḍa does not deserve to visit the recluse Gotama;

original: samaṇo tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ soṇadaṇḍaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamitun”ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ tu eva gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam soṇadaṇḍam dassanāya upasaṅkamitun ti
translated: rather, the recluse Gotama deserves to visit Master Soṇadaṇḍa.”

original: 3. Buddhaguṇakathā
analyzed: buddha guṇa kathā
translated: The Discussion of the Buddha’s Qualities

original: Evaṁ vutte, soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo te brāhmaṇe etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte soṇadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ te brāhmaṇe etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Soṇadaṇḍa replied:

original: “Tena hi, bho, mamapi suṇātha, yathā mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: tena hi bho mama api suṇātha yathā mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: “Well then, sirs, listen to why I say that I alone deserve to visit the recluse Gotama,

original: na tveva arahati so bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: na tu eva arahati saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: but he is not worthy to come and see me.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā, akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: The ascetic Gotama is well-born on both his mother’s and his father’s side, of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken, of irreproachable birth, and so🔽because of this he is not worthy to come and see me;🔽but I am worthy to go and see him.🔽The ascetic Gotama has gone forth from the Sakyan clan,

original: Yampi, bho, samaṇo gotamo ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva
analyzed: yam pi bho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva
translated: which is rich, wealthy, and prosperous,🔽and he has given up much gold and bullion buried and stored away, as well as much gold and bullion in the fields and the gold and bullion in the foundations of the houses, and so

original: sattamā pitāmahayugā, akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena, imināpaṅgena na arahati so
analyzed: sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena iminā apaṅgena na arahati so
translated: because of this he is not worthy to come and see me;🔽but I am worthy to go and see him.

original: bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ;
analyzed: bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: The ascetic Gotama has gone forth from the Sakyan clan, which is powerful and influential,🔽and he has given up much power and influence, and so🔽because of this he is not worthy to come and see me;

original: atha kho mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo mahantaṁ ñātisaṅghaṁ ohāya pabbajito …pe…
analyzed: atha kho mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ mahantam ñāti saṅghaṃ ohāya pabbajitaḥ pe
translated: but I am worthy to go and see him.🔽The ascetic Gotama has gone forth from the Sakyan clan, which is rich, wealthy, and prosperous,

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo pahūtaṁ hiraññasuvaṇṇaṁ ohāya pabbajito bhūmigatañca vehāsaṭṭhaṁ ca …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ pahūtam hirañña suvaṇṇam ohāya pabbajitaḥ bhūmi gatam ca vehāsaṭṭham ca pe
translated: and he has given up much gold and bullion buried and stored away, as well as much gold and bullion in the fields and the gold and bullion in the foundations of the houses, and so🔽because of this he is not worthy to come and see me;🔽but I am worthy to go and see him.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo daharova samāno yuvā susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ daharaḥ uva samānaḥ yuvā susu kāḷa kesaḥ bhadrena yobbanena samannāgataḥ paṭhamena vayasā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ pe
translated: He went forth from the lay life to homelessness while still a youth, a black-haired young man endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, though my father and mother wished otherwise and wept with tearful faces.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo akāmakānaṁ mātāpitūnaṁ assumukhānaṁ rudantānaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ akāmakānam mātā pitūnam assu mukhānam rudantānam kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ pe
translated: He went forth from the lay life to homelessness while still a youth, a black-haired young man endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, though my father and mother wished otherwise and wept with tearful faces.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato, brahmavaṇṇī, brahmavacchasī, akhuddāvakāso dassanāya …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ pāsādikaḥ paramāya vaṇṇa pokkharatāya samannāgataḥ brahma vaṇṇī brahma vacchasī a khudda avakāsaḥ dassanāya pe
translated: He is handsome, comely, and graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion, with sublime skin.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sīlavā ariyasīlī kusalasīlī kusalasīlena samannāgato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sīlavā ariya sīlī kusala sīlī kusala sīlena samannāgato pe
translated: He is virtuous, of noble virtue, possessing noble virtue.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo kalyāṇavāco kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ kalyāṇa vācaḥ kalyāṇa vāc karaṇaḥ poriyāḥ vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā pe
translated: He is a good speaker with a good delivery; he speaks words that are courteous, distinct, flawless, and communicate the meaning.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo bahūnaṁ ācariyapācariyo …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ bahūnam ācariya pācariyaḥ pe
translated: The recluse Gotama has been a teacher of teachers. …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo khīṇakāmarāgo vigatacāpallo …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ khīṇa kāma rāgaḥ vigata cāpallaḥ pe
translated: The recluse Gotama is a teacher of a large body of followers, with many hundreds of followers, with many thousands of followers, with many hundreds of thousands of followers.🔽The recluse Gotama is one who has abandoned the destruction of life, who has laid down the rod for all living beings, and who is considerate and full of sympathy.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo kammavādī kiriyavādī apāpapurekkhāro brahmaññāya pajāya …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ kamma vādī kiriya vādī apāpa purekkhāraḥ brahmaññāya pajāya pe
translated: The recluse Gotama is one who teaches the efficacy of action, the doctrine of kamma, and he proclaims the world of action.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo uccā kulā pabbajito asambhinnakhattiyakulā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ uccā kulā pabbajitaḥ asambhinna khattiya kulā pe
translated: The recluse Gotama has gone forth from an aristocratic family, from the Sakyans.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo aḍḍhā kulā pabbajito mahaddhanā mahābhogā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ aḍḍhā kulā pabbajitaḥ mahat dhanā mahā bhogā pe
translated: The recluse Gotama has gone forth from a wealthy family, from a family of great possessions and property.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ tiroraṭṭhā tirojanapadā pañhaṁ pucchituṁ āgacchanti …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam tiroraṭṭhā tirojanapadā pañham pucchitum āgacchanti pe
translated: People come from distant realms and foreign lands to ask the recluse Gotama questions.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ anekāni devatāsahassāni pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gatāni …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam anekāni devatā sahassāni pāṇehi saraṇam gatāni pe
translated: Many thousands of deities have gone for refuge for life to the recluse Gotama.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: This good report about the recluse Gotama has been spread:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti …pe…
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati pe
translated: ‘The Lord is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, knower of the world, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Lord.’ …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi samannāgato …pe…🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo ehisvāgatavādī sakhilo sammodako abbhākuṭiko uttānamukho pubbabhāsī …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇehi samannāgataḥ pe  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ ehisvāgata vādī sa khilaḥ sammodakaḥ abbhākuṭikaḥ uttāna mukhaḥ pubba bhāsī pe
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man …’ …🔽‘The ascetic Gotama speaks in praise of the four roads to power, and of the four bases of spiritual success, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path …’ …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo catunnaṁ parisānaṁ sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ catunnam parisānam sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed by King Bimbisāra of Magadha …’ …

original: Samaṇe khalu, bho, gotame bahū devā ca manussā ca abhippasannā …pe…🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo yasmiṁ gāme vā nigame vā paṭivasati, na tasmiṁ gāme vā nigame vā amanussā manusse viheṭhenti …pe…
analyzed: samaṇe khalu bho gotame bahū devā ca manussā ca abhippasannā pe  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ yasmin gāme vā nigame vā paṭivasati na tasmin gāme vā nigame vā amanussāḥ manusse viheṭhenti pe
translated: ‘Many gods and humans have faith in the ascetic Gotama …’ …🔽‘Wherever the ascetic Gotama stays in a village or town, there he can be found honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed, among the nobles, the brahmins, the merchants, and the workers …’ …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo saṅghī gaṇī gaṇācariyo puthutitthakarānaṁ aggamakkhāyati.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ saṅghī gaṇī gaṇa ācariyo puthu tittha karānam aggam akkhāyati
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is the leader, the teacher of a multitude, a community, a group, and an order, and he is honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed by it …’ …

original: Yathā kho pana, bho, etesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ yathā vā tathā vā yaso samudāgacchati,
analyzed: yathā khalu pana bho etesam samaṇa brāhmaṇānam yathā vā tathā vā yasaḥ samudāgacchati
translated: But, sir, the fame of these ascetics and brahmins has arisen in one way or another,

original: na hevaṁ samaṇassa gotamassa yaso samudāgato.🔽Atha kho anuttarāya vijjācaraṇasampadāya samaṇassa gotamassa yaso samudāgato …pe…
analyzed: na ha ivam samaṇassa gotamassa yasaḥ samudāgataḥ  atha kho anuttarāya vijjā caraṇa sampadāya samaṇassa gotamassa yaso samudāgato pe
translated: But the fame of the ascetic Gotama has not arisen in this way.🔽It has arisen because of his unsurpassed knowledge and conduct.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ sa puttaḥ sa bhariyaḥ sa parisaḥ sāmaccaḥ pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha …

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ rājā pasenadi kosalo saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ sa puttaḥ sa bhariyaḥ sa parisaḥ sa amaccaḥ pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: King Pasenadi of Kosala …

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti sa puttaḥ sa bhariyaḥ sa parisaḥ sa amacco pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: Brahman Pokkharasati …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ raññaḥ māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: The ascetic Gotama is honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and given homage—that is, by King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo rañño pasenadissa kosalassa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ raññaḥ pasenadissa kosalassa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: The ascetic Gotama is honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed by King Pasenadi of Kosala …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: by the brahmin Pokkharasati …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo campaṁ anuppatto, campāyaṁ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ campam an uppattaḥ campāyam viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre
translated: The ascetic Gotama has arrived at Campa and is now staying by Gaggara’s lotus-pond.

original: Ye kho pana, bho, keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā amhākaṁ gāmakhettaṁ āgacchanti atithī no te honti.
analyzed: ye kho pana bho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā amhākam gāma khettam āgacchanti atithī no te honti
translated: And any ascetics or brahmins who come to our villages and towns are our guests.

original: Atithī kho panamhehi sakkātabbā garukātabbā mānetabbā pūjetabbā apacetabbā.
analyzed: atithī kho pana amhehi sakkātabbā garukātabbā mānetabbā pūjetabbā apacetabbā
translated: And a guest should be honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed by us.

original: Yampi, bho, samaṇo gotamo campaṁ anuppatto campāyaṁ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre, atithimhākaṁ samaṇo gotamo;
analyzed: yam pi bho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ campam an uppattaḥ campāyam viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre ati thimhākam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ
translated: And since the ascetic Gotama has come to Campa and is staying by Gaggara’s lotus-pond, he is our guest.

original: atithi kho panamhehi sakkātabbo garukātabbo mānetabbo pūjetabbo apacetabbo.
analyzed: atithi kho pana mhehi sakkātabbaḥ garukātabbaḥ mānetabbaḥ pūjetabbaḥ apacetabbaḥ
translated: And since he is our guest, he should be honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed by us.

original: Imināpaṅgena na arahati so bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: iminā apaṅgena na arahati saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: On this ground he is not worthy to come and see me.

original: Atha kho mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: atha kho mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: On the contrary, I am worthy to go and see him.

original: Ettake kho ahaṁ, bho, tassa bhoto gotamassa vaṇṇe pariyāpuṇāmi, no ca kho so bhavaṁ gotamo ettakavaṇṇo.
analyzed: ettake kho aha bho tassa bhotaḥ gotamassa vaṇṇe pariyāpuṇāmi no ca kho saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ ettaka vaṇṇaḥ
translated: I have learned this much of his praise, but the Reverend Gotama is worth even more than this.

original: Aparimāṇavaṇṇo hi so bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: aparimāṇa vaṇṇaḥ hi saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ iti
translated: For his praise is boundless.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, te brāhmaṇā soṇadaṇḍaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte te brāhmaṇā soṇadaṇḍam brāhmaṇam etat avocuḥ
translated: When this was said, the brahmins said to Sonadanda:

original: “yathā kho bhavaṁ soṇadaṇḍo samaṇassa gotamassa vaṇṇe bhāsati ito cepi so bhavaṁ gotamo yojanasate viharati, alameva saddhena kulaputtena dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ api puṭosenā”ti.
analyzed: yathā kho bhavam soṇadaṇḍaḥ samaṇassa gotamassa vaṇṇe bhāsati ito ca ipi saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ yojana sate viharati alam eva saddhena kula puttena dassanāya upasaṅkamitum api puṭosena ati
translated: “If the Reverend Sonadanda speaks so highly of the recluse Gotama, then it is worth a faithful clansman going to see him even from a distance of forty-five kilometres.”

original: “Tena hi, bho, sabbeva mayaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bho sabbe iva mayam samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissāma ati
translated: “Well then, let us all go to see the recluse Gotama.”

original: 4. Soṇadaṇḍaparivitakka
analyzed: soṇa daṇḍa parivitakka
translated: The Discussion with Sonadanda

original: 7. Soṇadaṇḍaupāsakattapaṭivedanā

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: in the same way has Master Gotama - through many lines of reasoning - made the Dhamma clear.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gataṁ.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gata
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Adhivāsetu ca me bhavaṁ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu ca me bhavam gotamaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: Please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.

translated: Then Soṇadaṇḍa, understanding that the Buddha had consented, got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:🔽“kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.

translated: The following morning Soṇadaṇḍa had various kinds of fine food prepared in his own house. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena soṇadaṇḍassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena yena soṇadaṇḍassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Soṇadaṇḍa’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Atha kho soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
analyzed: atha kho soṇadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi
translated: Then Soṇadaṇḍa personally served various kinds of fine food to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: Atha kho soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho soṇadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi  eka mantam nisinnaḥ kho soṇadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When the Buddha had finished his meal, Soṇadaṇḍa sat down to one side

original: “ahañceva kho pana, bho gotama, parisagato samāno āsanā vuṭṭhahitvā bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ abhivādeyyaṁ, tena maṁ sā parisā paribhaveyya.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana bho gotama parisa gataḥ samānaḥ āsanā vuṭṭhahitvā bhavantam gotamam abhivādeyya tena mama sā parisā paribhaveyya
translated: and said to him, “Master Gotama, if I were to get up from my seat and bow down to Master Gotama, the assembly would lose confidence in me.

original: Yaṁ kho pana sā parisā paribhaveyya, yasopi tassa hāyetha.
analyzed: yam kho pana sā parisā paribhaveyya yasā upi tassa
translated: And if the assembly loses confidence in me, my fame would diminish.

original: Yassa kho pana yaso hāyetha, bhogāpi tassa hāyeyyuṁ.
analyzed: yassa kho pana yasaḥ hāyetha bhogā api tassa hāyeyyu
translated: And if my fame diminishes, my income would diminish.

original: Yasoladdhā kho panamhākaṁ bhogā.
analyzed: yasaḥ laddhāḥ kho pana amhākam bhogāḥ
translated: But we live on fame.

original: Ahañceva kho pana, bho gotama, parisagato samāno añjaliṁ paggaṇheyyaṁ, āsanā me taṁ bhavaṁ gotamo paccuṭṭhānaṁ dhāretu.🔽Ahañceva kho pana, bho gotama, parisagato samāno veṭhanaṁ omuñceyyaṁ, sirasā me taṁ bhavaṁ gotamo abhivādanaṁ dhāretu.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana bho gotama parisa gataḥ samānaḥ añjalim paggaṇheyya āsanā me tam bhavam gotamaḥ paccuṭṭhānam dhāretu  ahan ca iva khalu pana bho gotama parisa gataḥ samānaḥ veṭhanam omuñceyya sirasā me tam bhavam gotamaḥ abhivādanam dhāretu
translated: If, when I am in an assembly, I raise my joined palms in salutation, may Master Gotama remember me as one who has greeted him.🔽If, when I am in an assembly, I remove my headdress, may Master Gotama remember me as one who has greeted him.

original: Ahañceva kho pana, bho gotama, yānagato samāno yānā paccorohitvā bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ abhivādeyyaṁ, tena maṁ sā parisā paribhaveyya.
analyzed: ahan ca iva kho pana bho gotama yāna gataḥ samānaḥ yānā paccorohitvā bhavantam gotamam abhivādeyya tena mam sā parisā paribhaveyya
translated: If, when I am in a vehicle, I get down from it and worship Master Gotama, the people in the assembly will despise me.

original: Yaṁ kho pana sā parisā paribhaveyya, yasopi tassa hāyetha, yassa kho pana yaso hāyetha, bhogāpi tassa hāyeyyuṁ.
analyzed: yam kho pana sā parisā paribhaveyya yasaḥ upi tassa hāyetha yassa kho pana yasaḥ hāyetha bhogā api tassa hāyeyyu
translated: And if the people in the assembly despise me, my fame will diminish, and with the diminishing of my fame my wealth will diminish.

original: Yasoladdhā kho panamhākaṁ bhogā.
analyzed: yasaḥ laddhāḥ kho pana amhākam bhogāḥ
translated: For our wealth depends on our fame.

original: Ahañceva kho pana, bho gotama, yānagato samāno patodalaṭṭhiṁ abbhunnāmeyyaṁ, yānā me taṁ bhavaṁ gotamo paccorohanaṁ dhāretu.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana bho gotama yāna gataḥ samānaḥ patoda laṭṭhim yānā me tam bhavam gotamaḥ paccorohanam dhāretu
translated: If, when I am in a vehicle, I raise my goad, may Master Gotama remember me as one who has got down from his vehicle and worshipped him.”

original: Ahañceva kho pana, bho gotama, yānagato samāno chattaṁ apanāmeyyaṁ, sirasā me taṁ bhavaṁ gotamo abhivādanaṁ dhāretū”ti.
analyzed: aham ca iva khalu pana bho gotama yāna gataḥ samānaḥ chattam apanāmeyya sirasā me tam bhavam gotamaḥ abhivādanam dhāretu uti
translated: If I were to lower my parasol while riding in my chariot, then you should know that I have paid homage with my head to the feet of Master Gotama.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā soṇadaṇḍaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmīti.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā soṇadaṇḍam brāhmaṇam dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi iti
translated: Then the Blessed One, having instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged Soṇadaṇḍa the brahmin with a Dhamma talk, got up from his seat and left.

original: Soṇadaṇḍasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: soṇadaṇḍa suttam niṭṭhitam catuttha
translated: The Soṇadaṇḍa Sutta is finished.
